content.description:
After TR'ing '

Crucifiction

', try the direct start, avoiding the first two bolts on '

The Mantra

.'  Climb directly up the hideously wet, mungeful, and technical seam.  Most will find this route awful, I quite enjoyed it.
content.protection:
This

was

TR only. If it ever dried out, it might be worth developing. It is good alpine training as a TR.

climbs.name: The Mantra
climbs.fa: Richard Rossiter and Gail Effron, June 1996

content.description:
The Icon is easily located if you hike down the west approach trail to Dream Canyon. It looms on your left, about 50' above the creek and is a narrow slab with a steep gully on the right and a line of bolts along the right arete.

Easy climbing (5.6 or so) leads to a high first bolt just above the first crux. Only those with long arms or taller than 5'6" be able to reach this first bolt! (Trust me I'm 5'6".) Do hard moves over the lip with a bad left undercling, then follow the bolts through easier climbing over to the arete. The moves at the fifth  bolt are the other crux. This is superb climbing - lots of no hands rest and good footwork required. Lower off  about 80 feet.
content.protection:
A scramble up the gully on the left would reach the anchors for toproping. There are two bolts with rings. The arete is hard to toprope due to swing potential. Bring eight quickdraws.

Per

Carl Schaefer

: bring 9 protection quickdraws and something for the anchors if you plan to clip the first bolt of

Cruxifriction

.

content.description:
This climb breaks left from the second bolt on '

The Mantra

.'  Challenging moves through a dirty and flaring bulge gain an awesome hand crack.  Dirty slabs take you to the top where there is currently tat on a few trees.  A 60m rope will barely get you to the ground from the farthest tree back.  Be careful!
content.protection: TR only right now.  The climb might deserve a few bolts at the top for ease of TR'ing.  I had considered adding a few and seeing if it cleans up after a couple burns.  Then it might be worthy to lead. In the current condition it is, this route is best left as a TR.
content.location:
Start as for '

The Mantra

' and head left after the second bolt.  See the topo.

content.description: This listing is to help fill out routes on a minor subproject to help those who are looking for clearer descriptions of routes in Boulder Canyon & Dream Canyon.  So, this route ascends a right-facing dihedral of the left side of the Icon.  I'm not sure it's worth the effort.  Maybe a bomb rating is being too harsh, but there are rounding errors.  0.47 stars.
content.protection: A standard rack with some wide gear.
content.location: This is on the left side of the Icon.
